om.stdcomponent
Class ListComponent

java.lang.Object
  om.stdquestion.QComponent
      om.stdcomponent.ListComponent

public class ListComponent
extends QComponent

This is a component to layout bulletted and numbered lists.
The list component will arrange the components directly below as a list.

Example XML usage

This is a list of fruit
<list type='number'>
<t>Apple</t>
<t>Pear</t>
<t>Orange</t>
</list>

Properties

PropertyValuesEffect
type(optional string; 'bullet'|number')type of list
id(string)Specifies unique ID
lang(string)Specifies the language of the content, like the HTML lang attribute. For example 'en' = English, 'el' - Greek, ...
The default list type is 'bullet'.

initChildren

protected void initChildren(org.w3c.dom.Element eThis)
                     throws OmException
Description copied from class: QComponent
Initialises children based on the given XML element.

This default implementation treats all child elements as components. If you want to include text as well or treat elements differently (if they have a specific meaning for your components) you need to override this method. QDocument.buildInside() and similar will be useful; or you may wish to call initAsText.

Overrides:
initChildren in class QComponent
Parameters:
eThis - XML element representing this component
Throws:
OmException - If there's an error initialising the children

                          throws OmException
Description copied from class: QComponent
Builds up content of this component that should end up in question output. Only called if the 'display' property is set to true.

Default implementation just calls produceChildOutput().
